Mitigation: The risk for AIS/FFHPP/SARP is considered low with high certainty (check with SAR)

The risk for AIS/FFHPP/SARP is considered low with high certainty since these activities have historically been carried out in this waterbody. However, I do note that Rainbow trout are not native to NS and that the assessed risk level is contingent on the routine nature of these activities and extreme care should be taken to prevent escapees. Pursuant to s.10 of the Aquatic Invasive Species Regulations: "It is prohibited for any person to introduce an aquatic species into a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where it is not indigenous unless authorized to do so under federal or provincial law." Furthermore, this I&T permit would not constitute authorization to introduce an aquatic species into a particular region or body of water.
